title: Find Somebody Who Loves You Like Martin Scorsese Loves Adam Driver
text:
Mr. Hugs! Photo: Vivien Killilea/Getty Images

Not to sound too hyperbolic during a holiday weekend, but please inject this cinephile cuteness into our veins. Immediately! Martin Scorsese, who’s proudly serving a second term as Vulture’s honorary grandfather, cemented his Adam Driver fanboy status last night at the Telluride Film Festival, when he made a surprise appearance at Driver’s tribute panel. (He received one of the festival’s Silver Medallions.) Scorsese previously directed Driver in the faith-tastic Silence, and spent most of his speech fawning over how talented his pal is. “I can’t tell you the perseverance and the beauty of the performance, and the experience I had with him,” Scorsese said, among other remarks. “He has marvelous screen presence. One of the best, if not the best, actors of his generation.”

Adam Driver surprised at his Telluride tribute by Martin Scorsese, part 3 (“one of the finest, if not the finest, of his generation”)... pic.twitter.com/lcRY6U7f8s — Scott Feinberg (@ScottFeinberg) September 1, 2019

[Sniffles.]
description: Martin Scorsese called Adam Driver the best actor of his generation in a lovely speech about Adam’s acting abilities.
